column1: What is the maximum temperature that can be reached by the combustion of methane with 20% excess air? Both the methane and the air enter the burner at 25°C.
The reaction is CH4 + 2O2 → CO2 + 2H2O(g) for which
⟨ C P ° ⟩ H ≡  ∑ i   n i  ⟨ C Pi °  ⟩ H
⟨ C P ° ⟩ H =  ∑ i   n i  ⟨ C Pi °  ⟩ H = R [ ∑ i   n i  A i +   ∑ i  n i  B i  _ 2   (T −  T 0 ) +    ∑ i  n i  D i  _ T  T 0   ]
